title: Category:Biologically based therapies - Wikipedia
cleaned_text: of |[Alternative medicine](/wiki/Alternative_medicine) Biologically based therapies is the precise name of a [NCCIH](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC2754854/) classification for [alternative treatments](/wiki/Alternative_medicine) that use substances found in nature, such as: - botanicals - animal-derived extracts - vitamins - minerals - fatty acids - amino acids - proteins - prebiotics and probiotics - whole diets - functional foods. Subcategories This category has the following 10 subcategories, out of 10 total. D [Dietary supplements](/wiki/Category:Dietary_supplements) (6 C, 227 P, 1 F) E [Eclectic medicine](/wiki/Category:Eclectic_medicine) (8 P) G [Galactagogues](/wiki/Category:Galactagogues) (16 P) M [Medicinal herbs and fungi](/wiki/Category:Medicinal_herbs_and_fungi) (4 C) [Medicinal use of cannabis](/wiki/Category:Medicinal_use_of_cannabis) (2 C, 27 P) O [Orthomolecular medicine](/wiki/Category:Orthomolecular_medicine) (1 C, 10 P) [Ozone therapy](/wiki/Category:Ozone_therapy) (4 P) P [Probiotic foods](/wiki/Category:Probiotic_foods) (6 C, 3 P) Pages in category "Biologically based therapies" The following 41 pages are in this category, out of 41 total.
